oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Carte de visite of Abraham Lincoln
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The lack of a black border around the image indicates that it was produced before Lincoln was assassinated. The reverse side bears a U. S. Internal Revenue 2-cent stamp with an image of George Washington. The Internal Revenue Act of 1864 taxed; photographic images to raise additional funding for the Civil War. It also has the stamp of T. F. Saltsman, a photographer in Nashville.
